Comments_List: I entered this class with little knowledge of the subject matter, but left with a much better understanding of the influence, actions, and legacy of the Mughals. It was a fascinating and extremely engaging course.
An unseen side of medieval India from the lens of the dynamic Mughal empire--I learnt a lot about the material itself and explored creative ways of approaching the topic.
To critically look at the history of Mughal India by understanding its impact on contemporary Indian communal conflicts.

I have learnt a lot about the different factor that led to inception and decline of the Mughal Empire. This has been a great opportunity for me to step out of my comfort zone and dwell into the history of the Mughal rule which is something that i did not get to zoom in to in the past.

More background knowledge to help those with limited backgrounds in Indian history. Explanations of the readings prior to reading them would be helpful. Sometimes I started reading and was not sure what the context of the text.
Well structured course. Good topic selection.

The strength of the course were the student discussion as I got to learn more insights by the students in class. I also found the lecturer's choice of readings wonderful as they gave a whole new dimension to approaching Mughal History. I felt that the slides could be more engaging
A bit difficult if have little to no background in Indian history. Class was run more like a seminar than a lecture.
Yes, it was highly engaging and covered the subject matter very well.
Yes! You will learn so much about a fascinating period and region from a kind, knowledgable and very intelligent instructor.
If only to learn a necessary stage in Indian history.

I would definitely recommend this course to students who would want to go beyond understanding Mughal history just by its architecture but through other areas such as art, politics and economics as well.
